attributes.action: Create a National holiday on Queens birthday and move August BH to Sept
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Amend the Bank Holiday Act (1971) to remove the 2nd May bank holiday, create a national holiday on last Monday of June for Queens birthday and move August BH to end of September to balance out the year.
The aim is to instill national pride with a focused day and balance the holidays through the year.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
